definition: proficient (in sth)/to understand sth through and through
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
dawn/daybreak/to know/to let sb know/to make explicit

sentences.english: Any fool can create wealth, but only the wise know what to do with it.
sentences.chinese: 愚者亦能创造财富，唯有智者才通晓用财之道。

sentences.english: She rarely had to access the Jedi archives; her knowledge of galactic politics was immense.
sentences.chinese: 她通晓银河系的政治状况，几乎不用去查绝地档案馆。

sentences.english: Integration into the multi-ethnic life, proficient in English is essential.
sentences.chinese: 融入多元种族生活，通晓英语，至关重要。

sentences.english: The student knowing English will help him in learning French.
sentences.chinese: 这位学生通晓英语对他学法语很有帮助。

sentences.english: As a frequent moviegoer, I am keeping abreast of the latest development of Hollywood movies.
sentences.chinese: 我是电影院里的常客，通晓好莱坞电影最新动态。

sentences.english: He knows all the Indian languages and dialects.
sentences.chinese: 他通晓印第安语和方言。

sentences.english: Michael is all genned up computers.
She thinks she knows all, as maybe most mothers do.
sentences.chinese: 她总认为她通晓天下事，可能每位作母亲的都是这样。

sentences.english: Bob is a man of the world; why not go to him for advice?
sentences.chinese: 鲍勃是个通晓世故的人，干吗不去听听他的意见呢？

sentences.english: He telleth all things Past and to Come.
sentences.chinese: 他通晓所有的事物的过去和将来。

sentences.english: He knew all the local languages and dialects.
sentences.chinese: 他通晓当地所有的语言和方言。

sentences.english: Most of the students understand English well.
sentences.chinese: 这些学生中大多数通晓英语。

sentences.english: The worldly-wise students had seen videos of the Tiananmen massacre online.
sentences.chinese: 通晓世事的学生们曾在网上目睹当时的视频。

sentences.english: He knew four languages and traveled around the kingdom for the leader.
sentences.chinese: 他通晓四种语言，并曾为皇帝遍游整个王国。

definition: to be proficient in/to master (a subject)
conversant with things past and present/erudite and informed
to read and re-read sth until one is familiar with it
erudite and multi-talented (idiom); versatile and able
have wide learning and a retentive memory/have encyclopedic knowledge
